titles.title: To reauthorize appropriations for the weatherization program under section 422 of the Energy Conservation and Production Act.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 103-662.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 359.

action.text: Mr. Sharp moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Renewable Energy.

committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: Renewable Energy, Energy Efficiency, and Competitiveness

bill.summary: 8/8/1994--Passed House amended. Amends the Energy Conservation and Protection Act to extend the authorization of appropriations for the weatherization assistance program for low-income persons through FY 1996.
